did.unittitle: Octavia Broske and George Bancroft Papers
did.abstract: Octavia Broske and George Bancroft were stage and screen actors in the early 1900s. The collection consists of newspaper clippings and ephemera related to their careers, with the bulk relating to Octavia Broske.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Octavia Broske and George Bancroft Papers (Collection Number 2311). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Richard Jones and Joan Jones, 2016

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.
Processed by Saoirse O'Malley under the supervision of Julie Graham, 2017.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Octavia Broske was born circa 1886, in Pennsylvania. She was an actress of both stage and silent film during the early 1900s. She was married to actor George Bancroft. She appeared on stage in a number of cities across the US including Boston, Chicago, Philadelphia, New York, and San Francisco, among others. Her stage credits include Belle of New York, Prince of Pilsen, Sultan of Sulu, Tillie's Nightmare, and A Waltz Dream, among others. She also appeared in silent films, including: The Great Adventure and She Loves and Lies. Octavia Broske died in 1967.

George Bancroft was born in Philadelphia, PA on September 30, 1882. He was educated at Annapolis. He began his stage career as black face entertainer in minstrel shows, eventually going on to act in New York stage dramas and musical comedies such as Ave Maria and Underworld. He made his screen debut in 1921 appearing in The Journey's End. Bancroft was often cast as a villian and/or tough good guys. His film credits include Angels with Dirty Faces (1938), The Docks of New York (1928), Mr. Deeds Goes to Town (1936), Old Ironsides (1926), The Pony Express (1925), Stagecoach (1939), and Underworld (1927). He retired from acting in 1942 to become a rancher. George Bancroft died in 1956.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of material related to the careers of actors Octavia Broske and George Bancroft. The bulk of the collection is newspaper clippings documenting Broske's stage performaces including The Belle of New York, Florodora, The Folies Beregere, Girls Will Be Girls, Prince of Pilsen, Sultan of Sulu, and Tillie's Nightmare. Additionally, there are clippings representing Bancroft's work in Ave Maria and Underworld, and a very small amount of ephemera, and photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Holographic notes, photographs of daughter, Georgette Octavia Bancroft (2 items), divorce decree from George Burke, and clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Blue Moon, Florodora, The Folies Bergere, The Garden of Melody, The Girl From Paris, Girls Will Be Girls, Jack and the Beanstalk, Mayor of Tokio, and The Politicians.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Featuring Bancroft. Mention of daughter, Georgette Octavia Bancroft. Notes from Norbert Lusk.

did.unittitle: The Belle of New York clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Featuring Broske. With notes from Chamberlin Brown (agency) regarding commission, and a note on Montgomery Ward stationery regarding performance (signature cannot be deciphered).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Featuring Broske. With photograph of Helen Rockefeller, Effie Hasty, Mattie Rinenburg, and Octavia Broske.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Featuring Broske. With playbill for an appearance at the Cincinnati Pen and Pencil Club.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Featuring Broske. The Film Spectator, Harrison's Reports, and Paramount Studio News. One issue of The Film Spectator does not appear related to George Bancroft or Octavia Broske.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Receipt from Edward Small, note from H. H. Wentworth, and unidentified receipts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: With mention about Oh! Oh! Delphine! and note from Bud Fischer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Printed image of unidentified women selling Christmas seals, canceled check signed by Octavia Bancroft, postcard addressed to Octavia Broske, business cards from others, and three Christmas cards. Christmas cards include one item from and two items to George and Octavia, one of which is from Tom Mix.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: One photograph of Vera inscribed to Octavia, and two photographs of unidentified males.

did.unittitle: Photograph of unidentified man and woman sitting on front steps of a house (1 item)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Inscribed: 'To our nicest and dearest daughter from [--] and Mama'. Part of the inscription missing due to damage to photograph.

did.unittitle: Orville Harrold debut in Pagliacci clippings
